item.description:
From the back of the box (translated):

GTP Compet brings the entire family together.

Suitable for all ages 6 to adult. It helps everyone learn the initial concepts of solid geometry while having fun and develops logic, dexterity, manual agility and a sense of observation. Educational and of exceptional content with numerous variants.

For two players, you must be the fastest to achieve the challenges imposed by the puzzle or 3D maps.

Solo, you need to build cubes of different sizes and difficulties from thousands of possible combinations.

From the introduction:

The Heroes are trapped in the monster infested, ever changing, dungeon of the Lich King! They must find the exit and escape before the Lich King summons an undefeatable Dragon to kill them all!

User comments:

Bulk of document consists of print-and-play components, primarily paper maps to construct the dungeon and paper counters representing the players and various monsters. Game play consists of placing character tokens on a starting map, surviving combats and collecting treasure, and then moving into new areas looking for the dungeon exit. Game provides four character "types" (Wizard, Archer, Barbarian, Knight) and three monster "types" (Orc, Goblin, Dragon).

EcoChains is a multiplayer card game about climate change -- life and the struggle for survival in a rapidly warming Arctic. Players build food chains as they learn about Arctic ecosystems and how humans impact the environment (e.g. how carbon pollution and diminishing sea ice can impact Arctic species). The game was produced by Jogolabs and designed by a team of environmental scientists, educators and game designers.

Gameplay is simple: Sea Ice cards form the base of each player's food web. Each player builds food chains by connecting various Arctic species cards including polar bear, walrus, ringed seal and narwhal. Event cards such as carbon pollution occur, which melt sea ice and cause some animals to migrate or die. Players can also play Action cards in order to help protect their food chains. The player who keeps the most animals alive wins. Goal cards also provide additional Victory points.

http://www.ecochainsgame.com

Inconceivable: Kingdom at War is an intense microgame in which you must strategically read your opponent(s) and respond accordingly. Each player controls a part of the remains of a broken kingdom, fighting to restore stability to the fallen empire. With four battle cards in hand, you must choose: Should you play your Knight? Your Archer? Do you call in your Sorcerer, or save it for a future round? It all depends on the action of your foes, so do not be deceived by their trickery.

Inconceivable is a 2-3 player game that lasts about 10-20 minutes on average. Each player has 4 warrior cards, which can be seen below. There are 18 loot cards that are mixed up and placed face-down, creating the playing field. On each turn, there can be anywhere from one to three rounds to win these loot cards. The progression of each turn is a mystery; so be strategic!

Deal 10 cards in a row. Kill 9 of them.

Each turn consists of activating a card and resolving its effect. Play proceeds until all cards except one have been eliminated or until no further moves are possible.

item.description:
City of Ideologies is a strategic board game in a futuristic setting for two up to four players.

Humanity had to leave Earth centuries ago and travels in search of a new home in a huge city by the vastness of space. Players assume the role of leaders who are trying to reshape the city after their vision in an erupting revolution against the old system. For this they must legislate, kindle demonstration, gain influence over the districts of the city and always keep an eye on the mood of the people and the changing game board.

Both the game board, as well as the laws are constantly changing, it is important to keep a cool head, gain advantage through agreements with other players or through own concepts or intrigue to weaken the position of the other players.

City of Ideologies combines different game mechanics: You move protesters across the board, which turns around three times each round, role dice and push your luck, gain influence in districts, use different cards to perform unique actions and at the end of each round, one person is chosen by election of all players who is allowed to change a paragraph / rule mechanism.

Each action may be carried out in various ways. In most cases, they are paid with influence points, which vary from faction to faction depending on their main focus. If a player can not muster enough points for an action, then he can trade with his fellow players. Or he activates a district, which lets him perform the action or pulls a card that allows him to perform the action or uses a person of his faction. Or he changes a paragraph, so that the action costs less points.

The player who collects the most victory-points will win the game after five rounds. The way you collect victory points depends on the one hand on your ideology, which you choose at the beginning of the game. So every player gains victory points in different ways. For example, one player gets a victory point every time he prevents other players actions. Another player collects victory points if the other players give him voluntarily cards or influence points. On the other hand players can gain victory points on certain districts, by cards and paragraphs.

At the end the player will be victorious, who is both the most accurate follower of his ideology, as has also been successful in competitive areas.

The objective is to capture the opposition’s sacred book, release one’s captive ancestors and figuratively destroy the captured book at one’s altar.

Mechanically, the game is a roll and move format. Four players are required and the game is played in two teams--The People of Light versus The People of Darkness. Each player takes on an identity.

Game components include, a game board, deck of draw cards for each team, two sets of dice and other parts related to identity, movement and possession of goods.

The game board has an innovation where the end game expands the board by including a middle insert where the end game is played.

Welcome to the city of Machi Koro. You've just been elected Mayor. Congrats! Unfortunately the citizens have some pretty big demands: jobs, a theme park, a couple of cheese factories and maybe even a radio tower. A tough proposition since the city currently consists of a wheat field, a bakery and a single die.

Armed only with your trusty die and a dream, you must grow Machi Koro into the largest city in the region. You will need to collect income from developments, build public works, and steal from your neighbors' coffers. Just make sure they aren't doing the same to you!

Machi Koro is a fast-paced game for 2-4 players. Each player wants to develop the city on his own terms in order to complete all of the landmarks under construction faster than his rivals. On his turn, each player rolls one or two dice. If the sum of the dice rolled matches the number of a building that a player owns, he gets the effect of that building; in some cases opponents will also benefit from your die (just as you can benefit from theirs). Then, with money in hand a player can build a landmark or a new building, ideally adding to the wealth of his city on future turns. The first player to construct all of his landmarks wins!

The Machi Koro: Harbor Expansion injects further excitement into the game that has everyone talking! Want even more fun in your box?! Perhaps ten new establishments, one new starting establishment and two new landmarks will help?

item.description:
Dropfleet Commander is an Orbital Combat game in the Dropzone Commander universe in which the vast majority of your games will take place in orbit above a planet's surface.

A typical gaming table is 4'x4' and will show the surface of a planet rather than the more typical 'starfield' style space combat table. The area covered will be around the size of a large European country/US State.

Weapons range is neither absolute nor fixed. It can change based on the power of your ship's scanners, the enemy ship's signature and the enemy's actions (firing several weapons greatly increases a ships signature for example). Stealth is frequently crucial!

The 2-Player Starter Set for Dropfleet Commander includes:

- The Full Dropfleet Commander Rulebook, and Fast Play Sheets,
- UCM and Scourge Frigate and Cruiser Sprues, (with construction guides),
- Innovative Dropfleet Commander flight stands,
- Double sided fold out map,
- City markers,
- Token sheet,
- Tapemeasure and Dice

name.value: The Task of Ezrok: Deluxe Edition

item.description:
The Chest of Seth has found its way into the heartland kingdoms. Fortunately, king Morem has ordered the destruction of this evil relic. Your aim is to oversee Ezrok and his companions as they transport the chest far away from civilization. This task will take you through the Swamps of the Black Dragon, the Hills of Vorkin, and deep into an icy wasteland where the chest must be destroyed in the Eternal Chasm.

This game uses a tile laying system to move Ezrok and his companions across the different regions toward their goal. It is after this point that Ezrok can arrive at the Eternal Chasm to destroy the chest and begin the second challenge- the return trip.

This compilation includes the base game, a new deck, and favored expansion components to create the ultimate solitaire tile-laying adventure. The edition includes:


 Tile Cards
 Character Roster Cards
 Quest Cards
 Cosmic Boost Deck (new)
 Wandering Threats Deck
 Wild Cards Deck
 Power Cards Deck
 Enhanced Reference Material
 Rulebook and Bonus Booklet
 Printed Box


___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

The game can be played in two different modes. The "Training Operation" mode is a free-for-all where players try to prove they are the most qualified hacker for the secret agent position. The "Special Operation" mode is a team mode (all vs. one) where one player takes on the role of a rogue agent trying to protect secret information. The other players try to recover all of the critical data before security shuts the whole system down.

In both modes gameplay proceeds in turns. During a player's turn he will move his pawn from one tile to another (which represents accessing different computer systems) across connection points, revealing facedown tiles in the process. Each revealed tile will indicate how many data tokens are to be placed on the tile facedown. A player on that tile can choose to take the data tokens which each indicate a value on their face which is kept hidden from the other players. Collected data tokens can be saved by a player by returning to his start tile. A player can also leave firewall and virus tokens on a tile which will slow other players down. In addition to finding data on revealed tiles, players can also find antivirus tokens and firewall access tokens which will allow them to move to a tile containing a virus or firewall. If two players' pawns are on the same tile one of them may initiate a hack attack, which involves rolling dice. The victor may steal a data token from the loser.

The game continues for 11-15 rounds after which the player who has saved the most data is the winner (in "Training Operation" mode).

In "Special Operation" mode the rogue agent must prevent the other agents from retrieving all of the data tokens before time runs out.

Each player owns six pieces of heights 1, 2 or 3. The objective of the game is to move the pieces thus the pieces of same height are in orthogonal adjacency. A single piece may move exactly as many steps in any direction as it is high. As soon as a piece is adjacent to an other piece it loses its own movement but may only move as far as one of the neighbours induces by its height.

One part hot potato, one part math — Math Dice Chase tests your ability to quickly do mental math. Game players must sit in a circle. Two players each roll a pair of dice, then multiply the two numbers shown on the dice. Hurry to roll the dice, call out your answer, and pass the dice before you get caught with a second pair in front of you! Once you get caught with two pairs of dice, you are eliminated. The final two players enter a modified round of play, and the person who can multiply the quickest wins.

Stratos Spheres is a the classic four-in-a-row game without the restrictions of the 2D board. In fact, there's no board at all because you build the game as you go. Using three-dimensional spheres, each player tries to connect four of their spheres in a row while stopping their competitor from doing the same. The first to connect four spheres horizontally, vertically, or diagonally wins.

The players move from earth to the moon and back. The first player back on earth wins the game. Movement is determined by 3 dice. The player may chose the result of one of the 3 dice to move his piece. After each players turn, the turntable is rotated one step, changing the available flight paths. The players may block each others flight manoevres by placing stop-counters on the flight control panel of their opponents.

A traditional style quiz game that features a Canadian theme and optional added elements of risk and wagering.

In the 'basic' game, players earn points by either answering the trivia questions posed by their opponents, or by their own questions being incorrectly answered twice.

In the advanced version, players are allowed to wager on whether opponents will correctly or incorrectly answer the question being asked.

A 3rd 'classroom' variation allows for group play by eliminating all advanced elements and simply posing questions to each team, with incorrect answers allowing the other team to 'steal' the point.

Play continues over as many ~5 minute rounds as players pre-determine, with the player or team with the most points being the victor.

Interestingly, this game was self-published sometime between 1980-1984 (based on question content) and includes no copyright date, publisher, or author information, other than a post-office box in Ottawa. A unique piece of Canadiana.

From the box: A quiz game exclusively for Canadians.
Thousands of Questions. Over 100 Categories.

Encompassing an "all-Canadian" theme, the questions cover a wide variety of topics. From PRIME MINISTERS to LAKES, from HOCKEY to EARLY DAYS, from INVENTIONS to MOVIES, there are 101 topics touching on all aspects of Canadian life. The questions are presented at three levels of difficulty with a corresponding point system. Players will find some questions easy, some "memory-testers", others educational.

Other Features of CANADA QUEST include:
-three variations
-second chance on each question
-time control
-wagering
-classroom use.

For 3-6 players / teams, Ages 12-adult. English.

The Classic Video Arcade Owners Game.

The classic video arcade in the golden age of gaming! Experience the lights, sounds & fun of the greatest arcade games on show and own them all! With players playing, buying & repairing cabinets the action heats up fast! Look out for power cuts, free plays, breakdowns and remember to empty your cabinets of all those shiny coins!

Overview:
Arcade-opoly is a 1(solo) to 4 player game where players dash around a classic video game arcade.

The object of the game is to buy and setup arcade games and begin to earn quarters from them. Your opponents will have to insert coins to play your arcade games should they stop in front them. Popular games will earn you double but don’t let your games break as “Out Of Order” games will earn you nothing.

Players move around the arcade clockwise by first throwing both a black and a white die. You may only move with either dice, choose wisely which of the dice to move with!

Gameplay cards collected by landing on the Gameplay spaces can help or hinder you. Some cards will offer free games, free plays or free repairs. Other cards though will trigger power cuts, force you to play an opponents game, move with only with one die or even send you back to Level 1.

To win the game you must be the first to collect enough coins from your arcade games coin box and reach the target money amount of 70 quarters. Be careful not to play or buy too many games because other costs may arise such as repair bills, loose change, power cuts and game crashes. Should a player lose all their startup money of 30 quarters the game ends. All the remaining players can then total up any coins left in their games with the highest being declared the winner.

Unique features:
Classic video game arcade theme.
2 dice choice mechanic
Money track scoring
16 colour wooden arcade cabinets
50 plastic coin Quarters to play & collect from the machines
36 gameplay cards
Power cuts, Free Plays, Free Repair and “Out Of Order” events
“Top Games” that earn double their price.
45 minute playtime.
3 lives per player for extended play.
Solo play variant as you compete against three CPU players.

A card game about player become the chef of food stall (waroong) that cooking traditional food in Indonesia and competing to become the best waroong in Indonesia.

The game consist of a total 80 cards. 40 cards are ingredient card, 20 card are menu card which has different VP each card, and 20 card are customer card which act like action and effect cards. The game played within 2 phase each round, Shopping and Cooking. In the preparation of the game, all card will be shuffled into their respective deck. Open 3 menu card face up in the table and put the rest beside. Each player then will receive a total of 6 ingredient cards for them to play.

In shopping phase, each player will take an ingredient card in their hand and put it face down in front of them. The ingredient taken will be use to "cook" the opened menu card in the table. Then the remaining card will be draft clockwise until the card in front of them has 6 cards total. This card will become a new hand for cooking the menu. The fun coming when drafting, all player must not see the card they already put in front of them face down. They must memorize the card until shopping is completed.

In cooking phase, start from player who have priority cooking, the player will choose witch menu they will cook using ingredient in their hand. Discard the ingredient that use to cook, and take that menu card and 1 customer cards. When taken, fill the the gap in menu card with new menu open from menu deck. The player will cook until they can't cook any menu. When this happen, discard the remaining ingredient to discard pile and the turn cooking will be pass to left player. After all player has their turn to cook over, the next round will be start, open new menu card so the size of menu queue will be up each round up to 6 cards open, pass priority cooking to player clockwise, and then give each player 6 new ingredient cards. Then the phase will be start over from shopping.

The game end when all menu card is already cooked or discarded. The winner will be decide from totaling the score in menu card, and customer card(if any). The player who has the biggest score will win the game.

item.description:
Cyber:Run is a fully cooperative cyber punk tactical-action game for 1-4 players, in which a team of cyber runners must fight their way through a corporate tower completing objectives while difficulty scales. The game makes use of optional video content that can enhance the experience by tying in elements from The Gamers Natural 20.

Players must solve time based puzzles, and collect enough resources to complete 6 objectives to win the game. If enough turns pass without the players completing their objectives, the game is lost.

Human beings are at the edge of existence — but they don't know it yet! Mother nature is about to strike back and reduce mankind to save the planet from being destroyed by the species that calls itself "homo sapiens".

In Viroid, players cooperate in taking the role of a virus and trying to infect people all over the world. They use events like the Olympic Games to spread their deadly effects. To be a step ahead of the human scientists, the players develop special features like infection by blood, infection via animals, or resistance against medicine, heat or cold.

The game is played in clockwise order. On your turn, draw an event card, which forces you to take back one or more of your tokens from the board (healing a city). If it is the last one in this city, the "healing token" on the specific track moves forward and you lose if it meets your marker on that track. The event card also gives you some additional "DNS points", which are akin to money. In the second step of your turn, you spread your virus depending only the methods for infection you have already developed. You gain additional DNS-points for each infection, such as placing new tokens onto the board in the cities. Third, you develop (buy for DNS) more features for your virus like infection via animal, resistance against cold or medicine, or your ability to kill people. Finally, you throw dice according to your skill for killing, and depending on the result, you replace your tokens on the board with dead tokens.

The players win if they have placed all dead tokens in the cities. They lose if the draw pile runs out or the human beings have made enough healing steps on the specific track.

Will you be able to save the planet and reduce the population of the greatest danger for the world — human beings?

item.description:
Pot 'O' Gold is themed after playing a slot machine, but is a dexterity game where players take turns spinning gold coloured plastic chips onto the game board. On the game board, there are cherries, oranges, plums, bells, and 7's, separated by pots of gold. If the chip lands on a pot, then the chip is added to the "jackpot". If the chip lands on one of the other symbols, players mark off that symbol on their score pad. After marking off any of the symbols for the fifth time, a player wins the current jackpot, and then that symbol will no longer win a jackpot for any player. The game ends when a jackpot is won for each of the five symbols, with the player with the most chips being the winner.

There is a unique game board design in Pot'O'Gold, where the board is actually 5 giant jigsaw pieces. This does not effect game play, is simply an alternative to having a game board that folds for storage.

In the 1990's, Video Lottery Terminals, or VLTs, became legal in the Canadian province of Alberta, and most bars and lounges had them installed. Different games could be played on the VLTs, including a five wheeled slot machine where you won by matching up cherries, oranges, plums, bells and 7s on a line. Pot'O'Gold is themed after the slot machines on those VLTs.

Two players battle it out in the attempt to knock out their opponent. If you decrease your opponent's health to zero, you win.

Players manage a dojo of skills using Experience Points to build a deck of attack and defense cards that can adapt to an opponent’s evolving strategy.
 The linear mat component allows players to control distance to avoid damage and get in range to strike.

Stuns and takedowns break an opponent’s rhythm leaving him/her without enough stamina to pull off brutal combos.

Holds can create an opening for attack and often work in combination with other moves creating another level of strategy.

'You Don't Say' is a word game played over multiple rounds, where players attempt to guess a specific word based on the verbal clues provided. 
Players are first divided into 2-4 teams of at least 2 people, who are either the 'Clue Givers' or 'Guessers', which may change between turns.

As the 'guessers' attempt to determine the mystery word, the clue givers are restricted by 3 simple rules:
-Cannot spell all or part of the word
-Cannot use the word itself, in any form
-Cannot use 'rhymes with' or 'sounds like' clues.

Each turn lasts the length of the included timer (about 1 minute) and so multiple word clues may be attempted if teams talk and answer fast.
Teams progress around the board based on the number of correctly guessed words each turn, plus a roll of the random 'bonus die'.

The first team to reach the 'FINISH' space on the gameboard is the winner!

From the Box:
The Talk FAST, guess FASTER game.

Talk about it. Act it out...But DON'T SAY IT!

You Don't Say is the hilarious, high-energy guessing game where fast talkers team with fast guessers to win!

Get your teammates to guess words based on your clues, without saying the words. The more they answer correctly, the father you move on the board.

With six world-encompassing categories and 3000 simple-to-challenging words, YOU DON'T SAY is fast-talking, quick-moving fun for everyone! 500 Cards! 3000 Words!

Stawka wiÄ™ksza niÅ¼ Å¼ycie (More than life at stake) is board game inspired by most popular tv series produced by TVP (Polish television) in 1967. This black and white series is broadcasted almost every year (by different Polish tv channels).

Action takes place during World War II in Poland occupied by Germans. In game one player becomes a member of the Polish resistance and try to execute tasks against occupants.

The second player becomes a member of German forces and tries to stop Polish actions.

Each player controls up to four agents. Each turn player choose a card which decides whose agent first makes his move and what is the amount of action points. This points can be used to moving agents on map and taking special actions like searching for items or evidence of illegal activity. They can try to talk with enemy agents to force them to reveal secret information. German agents may try arrest Poles but polish agents may try to make assassination of gestapo officers. After successful actions, players receive Victory Points.

Both players can play cards to use special effects or to disturb enemy actions.

Every scenario has special win conditions (like finding some items or execute some activities). If this conditions are not achieved, players must compare Victory Points they gathered.

link.value: Stawka większa niż życie: Cafe Rose

item.description:
Daggers is an asymmetrical abstract board game played on an 8x8 board.

As described by João Pedro Neto on The World of Abstract Board Games:

UPHILL & DOWNHILL - "Downhill" refers to the direction towards the "Low player", and "Uphill" refers to the direction towards the "High player".
DAGGER - Daggers slide along the column or diagonals downhill as far as they like, but only one cell uphill or diagonally uphill. There is no side movement. Daggers can capture any piece along the diagonals (going either uphill or downhill) and can capture Crowns (but not Daggers) along the column.
CROWNS - A Crown can move to any (orthogonal or diagonal) adjacent empty cell. A Crown can also capture any enemy piece on any (orthogonal or diagonal) adjacent cell. 
TURN - On each turn, each player moves one of his pieces. The High player moves first.
GOAL - A player wins by capturing an enemy Crown or by moving one of his own Crowns into the opponent's first row.

item.description: PitRush is an action-packed game of skill in which players try to capture the pits of the game board with their disks in order to earn the most points. Players take shots by flicking their disk with their finger. Opponent disks can be struck off, and pits can be taken over by stopping on top of the disk in the pit. Players score points based on the distance of the hole they occupy (or cover) from their shooting location on the edge of the board.

item.description:
A strategy card game about well intended people in bitter competition over exactly how to save the planet from climate change...and how to serve their own special interests while doing so.

Take on the role of a special interest group trying to save the world from a changing climate. However, while all the interest groups want to maximize positive impact, they all have different priorities for how to go about it. Are you advocating clean energy, habitat protection, or island nations that might get flooded? Will you pass laws to create subsidies, institute a carbon tax, or maybe attempt an ambitious geo-engineering project? Every method has its own benefits and drawbacks, and you will need strategic planning and political cunning to lead your organization to success.

Mechanics:
Players attempt to pass bills into law, both to have an impact in general and to further their own special interest's goals. However, all players will need to pursue a mixed strategy to succeed -- your special interest does not dictate your strategy. For example, a player might be rewarded for seeing enough geo-engineer projects succeed, regardless of who plays those cards -- so they might play those cards themselves or negotiate for someone else to play them.

Carbon Copy Politics uses a novel "clock" mechanic to track the progress of activities over time. Players play cards onto the clock, which ticks down each turn. Cards that reach the end of the clock resolve, building variable delays into the play of every card. The delay requires players to plan ahead, allow them to set up combos, and creates opportunities for disruption by opponents. For example, bill cards are typically delayed by 3 turns before they are evaluated, so you might play it one turn, play an action to boost public will-for-change the next turn, play a modifier on it the next turn, and then discard cards as the bill resolves to pay the rest of the cost.

Bill cards are rated by their difficulty (cost) and impact (score). Different types of bills offer different ways to pay the cost. Carbon Tax bills get easier to pass as more taxes are passes, while Cap and Trade bills are easier if several are played at the same time by different players.

name.value: Monopoly: Copa Mundial de la Fifa Brasil 2014

item.description:
Esta nueva versión del clásico Monopoly incluye dentro de su tablero a 22 de las 32 selecciones que participaron en la Copa del Mundo: Brasil, Colombia, España, Argentina, Alemania, Italia, Holanda, Portugal, Uruguay, Francia, Chile, Inglaterra, Estados Unidos, Rusia, Nigeria, Japón, México, Ecuador, Camerún, Corea del Sur, Costa Rica, y Honduras.
Monopoly Copa Mundial de la FIFA Brasil 2014 incluye: Tablero con las 22 selecciones, 6 fichas con diseños alusivos al mundial, 28 tarjetas de título de propiedad, 16 tarjetas fuleco y 16 tarjetas trofeo, 1 paquete de dinero, 32 casas, 12 hoteles y 2 dados.



Version of Monopoly themed on the 2014 Fifa World Cup, including competing nations in place of the traditional coloured property sets, stadia in place of the stations and half time/full time cards instead of the chance/community chest cards.

Alchemy of Askrias is a casual board game for 1 to 3 players (1 to 5 players with the added 4 to 5 player expansion). The game uses 'Askrias Cubes' which allow the players to socket game tiles, each of which have different abilities on them; which then allows the players to either create the victory points for the win or powerful spells to interfere with your opposing Alchemist's!

The game is focused mainly on actual dice building - each turn players will have the chance to add tiles to a 'Askrias Cube' depending on the formula that they choose which will then alter the way the game is played.

With extra cubes, the game can also be expanded up to 5 players.

name.value: The Twinkles Game: His Trip to the Star Factory

item.description:
The Twinkles Game: His Trip To The Star Factory. Based on the General Mills Twinkles The Star Shaped Cereal with the Twinkles the Elephant mascot.

The players choose to be one of four characters: Fulton the Camel, Wilbur the Monkey, Leopold the Lion or Sanford the Parrot. The players begin on the Start square, and the Twinkles playing piece starts several squares ahead. Players draw cards that have colors on them and move to the next square with that color on the board. Players must draw a card for Twinkles and move him on his turn, as well. Players cannot pass Twinkles, even if that means they cannot move. Certain squares award the players stars, and others take stars away (if they have any). When Twinkles finally makes it to the Star Factory, the game is over. The player who has the most stars, wins.

The cruel seamonster has taken a baby dino captive on the small island, guarding the waters around the island voraciously. The dinosaurs walk around the board, collecting the watersteps needed to get out to the island and rescue baby dino. On the way you can meet both the sea monster that steals watersteps and the pterodactyl that can fly you to a location of your choice. If you meet another dinosaur you can challenge it for watersteps. The winner is the player that reaches the island first and and saves babydino.

You start with placing the tiles on the board backside up, then take turns moving along the lines collecting waterstep tiles needed to save the baby dino, stone tiles are useless, landsteps are needed to cross certain sections.

GieÅ‚da, makler, akcje i obligacje... Te i inne ekonomiczne terminy weszÅ‚y juÅ¼ na trwaÅ‚e do naszego jÄ™zyka i Å¼ycia. Monopoly-like game about stock exchange. Buying and selling stocks, obligations, etc. to earn more money than other players.

The tracks on the board are two circles, touching on one edge.

Street Fighter Rivals takes the premises of Seiji Kanai's R (BraveRats) into the realm of fighting games. Instead of two equal decks, both players chose one of 8 characters, each with their individual 7 card deck. Winning with certain cards does a certain amount of damage. Win by bringing your opponents health down from 10 to 0.

name.value: The Big Bang Theory: Fact or Fiction Card Game

item.description:
This game is a small card game with 180 trivia cards in a little tin. It is small enough to fit in a small bag.

Roll the die to get a Fact or Fiction card. Answer a card correctly and you win that card. Be the first person to collect 5 cards and you win the game.

link.value: TV Series: The Big Bang Theory
The Big Bang Theory: Fact or Fiction Game

name.value: Generalship: from the 4th century B.C. to the 19th century

item.description:
Generalship is a compact strategy game and the players can experience the history of Europe.

You will compete using 49 highly famed generals in Europe from the 4th century B.C. to the 19th century. You choose a nation to rule: Austria, Byzantium, England, or France, and then appoint a general from the 49 ones available as your commander. Using this, you will run your nation internally by accumulating political power, increasing production and population, and developing technologies. You will handle your external politics by raising armies and managing alliance relationships.
 
While shaping history with other players, based on your efficient use of actions, the abilities of your commander, and a little bit of luck, you will be able to win by earning more victory points than your competitors. Specifically, players can earn victory points by winning battles or developing new technologies.

item.description: Sapotagem is a card game using trick-taking with set collection. In each trick, players have two options: play a card or pass. The winner of that trick is the player who played the highest card of color to be followed or the Trump color, if it has been played. The color of the trump of each round is determined by a list of cards in the middle of the table placed in the setup. The winner of each trick takes all the cards played, besides the card that determines the trump of the round, and places them in rows in his player area, separated by existing symbols. At the end of the game, each player gets victory points for each type of symbol that has, depending on the amount. Up to 3 symbols of a particular type, the score is positive. 4 to 6 symbols of the same type the score is negative. 7 or 8 symbols of the same type score is again positive. All cards 13 are time bombs, worth negative points, except that the same player has captured all 4! The winner has the most victory points!

item.description:
Help your cat to undress so that he can go to sleep.

Deal five pajama tops and bottoms to each player. Stack your pajamas on your cat. Place BJ the Cat on the game board. Roll the die and move BJ the Cat. If your pajamas match in color or pattern, you can take them off. The winner is the first person to get all of the pajamas off of their cat.

Not the same game as Cat's Pajamas:


 The IDEAlogists game is a card game, where you collect sets of sleeping kitties. 
 The Haywire/Tactic game does not have any cards, and you don't collect sleeping kitties but you help your cat to undress so that he can go to sleep.

Each player has a set of 3 pawns that start on the starting spaces of his color. The goal is to move the pawns around the board along the spiral to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by a die. All players move around the same board, so they may capture each other's pawns. Captured pawns are returned to their player's starting place and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".

On the back of the game board is the game Nine Men's Morris (Mühle).

Squish is a fun, family friendly, dexterity game for 1 to 6 players in which you drop player order cards (also referred to as boot cards) in an attempt to squish bug cards that are on the ground. You try to be the player with 10+ points at the end of a round. The bug cards are thrown into the air at the beginning of the game and fall where they may. After, you are ready to get Squishing! You go in number order according to your player order cards. You drop your player order cards from shoulder height, number side up, in an attempt to completely cover a bug. Bugs range in size and value. The bigger the bug, the more points it is worth. Beware though, because if your player order card lands boot side up someone can cover your number and take one of your squished bugs from you. You squish the bug and your friend steps on your toes and takes it from you. This could turn a win into a loss or a loss into a win. Getting 10 points is easy, keeping them is tough. Some dropping techniques can make it so that your card is boot side down and keeps you safe from anyone's nefarious plans of stepping on your toes.

A variant for younger crowds makes the game a bit easier by the requirement to cover a bug goes from, covering the entire bug, to covering just the head or body.

Squish: The Dexterity Card Game of Bug Squishery is a fun and easy game for kids of all ages and plays in only 30 minutes.

The Ultimate Football Strategy Game! The game is a dice and card, turn based game. The object of the game is to score more goals than your opponent in a set amount of time, or to be the first to score a pre-determind number of goals.

Players roll the dice, and move their playing pieces around the board, trying to get close enough to their opponents goal to take a shot. When a player lands with the ball on one of the Super 11 squares in their opponents half, they play an attacking card. These bonus cards can give them an advantage over their opponent through a shot at goal, yellow or red card, or a chance to roll again.

The game ends either after an agreed period of time, or once a player has scored the pre-agreed number of goals.

The object of the game is to become a successful Pop Group Manager, by gaining control of as many Groups as possible, and obtaining the cards for as many Cities marked on the board as you can. The ultimate success is to become a "Millionaire".

Imagine you are the manager of your favourite "Pop" group and that they are giving performances in the various cities where your counter lands.

Money is made from Group performance fees and 'Hire of Hall' charges, received when a player has the exclusive performance rights for a particular city. Fees are doubled if the rights for all four cities in a country are held.

Based on The New Adventures of Huckleberry Finn TV show produced by Hanna-Barbera and based on the classic Mark Twain characters. It featured live-action heroes in an animated world.

Comes with 60 paint strips and Injun Joe spinner. Players take turns spinning and collecting paint strips. Players lose their turn if they pick Injun Joe or a messy paint strip. The first player to "paint" his fence with 15 correct paint strips wins.

TINY GARDEN GROWERS

Game Summary
Tiny Garden Growers is a game about growing vegetable plants and harvesting the vegetables.
This is a dice rolling and placement game that also uses dexterity and counting skills.

Number of players: 2-3
Components: 1 game board and 50 dice (30 green or white, 10 red, 10 yellow) and rules!
Playing time: 10 to 15 minutes

link.value: Children's Game Print and Play Contest

item.description:
Tiny Token Toss

Tiny Token Toss is an 18-card - 1 or 2-player Dexterity chit tossing game. "I may be starting a trend with these games!"

It uses the same chit tossing mechanic from castle under siege but in a nice and simple point scoring game.

Tiny Token Toss uses 6 cards in front of each player "a seventh card can be added to the back row" with each card having a circle with point values in it. Each player takes turns tossing chits at the cards to try and obtain the most points or trying to knock their opponents chits off the cards.

The rules are simple and the game is a light filler style game! I calling this new innovative style of game "The chit toss game"! LOL

14 cards make up the scoring cards.
2 cards represent each player's toss card.
2 cards represent the bean bags.

If you think of the beach bean bag tossing game, that's this game in a nut shell!

CASTLE UNDER SIEGE

Castle under Siege is an 18-card - 1 or 2-player Dexterity Medieval Castle Siege game.

Player-1 controls the Catapult and tries to loft "boulder, fireball, and disease" towards a castle. You use one of the cards as an actual catapult; tossing ammunition at the castle.

Player-2 maintains the castle and must use his forces to put out fires, repair boulder damage, and take card of the injured soldiers. To do this you must move around the castle trying to reach and resolve each situation before it gets out of control. All the while trying to stay alive because if a boulder lands in an area where your forces are they are either killed or injured.

You have a limited supply of ammunition and once you run out the game is over. You tally your score to see if you breached the castle wall or tower. Or see how many forces you were able to kill!

The player of the castle wins by preventing a wall or tower breach and trying to save as many soldiers as possible.

Help Mr. Twiddle...Find The Runaway!

Players spin & move around the edge of the game, landing on question marks with different colors and numbers on them. Using a number wheel, players get a clue to the color, character or activity of the runaway. The winner is the first player to identify the runaway.

Tong is a print and play game from Bruno Cathala illustrated by Camille Chaussy.

At your turn, feed your chameleon then move it (from the number of insects the chameleon has eaten). The first who can't feed the animals loses the game.

item.description:
Mythomakya is a card game about greek mythology designed by Luca Feliciani and illustrated by Mirka Andolfo.

In the box, You'll find 110 cards that allow you to play two different games based on a similar game-play.

The aim of the game is to gain more golden apples than your opponents. When the first player plays a card, the opponents have to play a card of the same color. The one with the highest strenght, wins and puts all the cards in his treasure.
If a player cannot play the same color, he has to play another color and will always lose unless the color played is the moira, the dominant color choosen at the beginning of the game by one of the players.

In the version “Triumph of Heroes” you’ll use heroes as Hector, Aeneas, Jason and Perseus to conquer more golden apples than your opponents. Cards are placed in front of the players in ten 3-card stacks. Only the first card of each stack is visible. When it's played, the card below can be revealed.

In the version “God’s Challenge” deities from the Olympus will join the fight, such as titans, muses and orrible monsters with particular skills. In this version, indeed, each player can activate abilities of 30 special cards by eliminating from the treasure a number of golden apples. These abilities can change the game, since their effects are very strong.
Moreover, each player has some divinity cards in his hand. As per the abilities, a player has to eliminate golden apples from the treasure to play the divinity cards.
In this version, all the cards are displayed but only the first one of each stack is playable.

item.description:
Join Elefun's newest friend, the trouble-loving Chasin' Cheeky monkey in this ring-tossin' Chasin' Cheeky game. In this up-and-active game, Chasin' Cheeky will race around the room as you try to get your colored rings on his tail. Once you get all of your rings onto his tail, be the first to grab his banana and shake it with Chasin' Cheeky to celebrate your win.

Play again by putting the banana back in Cheeky's mouth.

item.description:
In Russia, everyone is responsible to the Motherland to ensure every citizens is a good comrade.

In Names of the Disloyal, you must turn in the names of those who are striving to disrupt the harmony among the people. Roll dice to gather the letters needed to discover the dissidents, use the help of your comrade workers, and find those rumored to be disloyal.

On your turn, you will roll dice, claim cards to your hand and then make names with those cards. The first player to a set number of names triggers the end game.

Game Contents:
162 Letter Cards (Letters of the Revolution)
36 Name Cards (Find the Disloyal)
8 Multi Letter Cards (Workers Unite)
7 Dice each in 4 different colors
12 Scoring Tiles
1 Scorepad

Unitar is a simultanuous-choice 8 round 3 person strategy poker and, hopefully, the Arabic game.

Goal
You win Unitar by dominating the field with your color, in other words the game color with the highest number of frames on the playing field wins.

Strategy
Each turn, every player selects one block of stones that will be moved or rotated. By doing so, blocks may start to overlap. When blocks overlap, actions can be selected to eliminate the overlapping pieces, or to unify the two blocks, which means that the squares they occupy are divided amongst the two colors.

Poker 
You have to guess your opponent's intended moves, because your own intended move will only be performed if it shares two characteristics with the other player's moves.
